subject: control: mapped_floor: Support floor offset param
commitMessage:
control: mapped_floor: Support floor offset param

Add support to the mapped floor action to read the name of an optional
floor offset parameter from the JSON.  If it's there, then any time a
floor is calculated it will add that offset to the floor value before
setting it.  This is added at the level of the key value, so that
particular offset is only applied to floors found in that section.

For example, if
     "key": 27,
     "floor_offset_parameter": "floor_altitude_offset",
     ...

is in the JSON config, it will add whatever value is in the
floor_altitude_offset parameter to the floor value it calculates when
that key value is valid.

This allows one to do something like set an floor offset based on the
current altitude.

Signed-off-by: Matt Spinler <spinler@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I39ab6287a6948058981aed1cdbae5e91aade80d9

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as a17d5cc08ab94f749b181757d699a6818fd8518a
I guess I could probably check that all of these are >= 0
Just so I know for sure, where is this defined in the JSON? is it per `key` or per mapped `floors` entry?

Ok, would it be possible to move this to per mapped `floors` entry(s)? Been talking with thermal on getting ready for compliance testing in regard to the use of altitude changing and they pointed out possibly needing different offsets per PCIe floor index, but I may have convinced them to only need it per ambient group. Since the highest floor of all the pcie indexes is chosen, the offset would then be applied per that key group (i.e. ambient).

What about if it was defined along with the `parameter`? It seems to me that the same offset would be applied per floor configured and not necessary to have the possibility of having different offsets per floor but maybe?

Obviously having it per floor gives us the most flexibility so I'm fine with this, but yes we'd need it available for applying against the default floor used as well.
If the floor also had to start depending on power modes or IPS active, think those would also need floor offsets?
Yes, I think the possibility of applying an offset needs to be available on all floor groupings per key.

There's been changes made in source around areas discussed here but the commit message has not been updated. Are all these concerns with where the offset is supported in the config done now in the latest changes?
It allows 1 floor_offset per action. I guess I lost track of this discussion here.  You'd still like the floor offset to be at the level of the parameter instead?

I looked into doing this, and get makes things pretty messy, since  the code has to remember which table entry the highest floor value came from.

I think a single offset value would still be doable since the floors can just be adjusted accordingly in the JSON.  Or maybe an offset per ambient table.

After meeting with thermal yesterday, the solution they are looking for is to have an offset per key (ambient) that can be applied to the floor chosen from all tables contained beneath that key, which includes if the results are a `default_floor`.
Probably should record that the offset resulted in a negative floor, so offset was not applied to floor for each of these.
I guess I forgot a static_cast<uin64_t>(), or I suppose that happens automatically
Add the action unique name to this. It will be useful once we switch to the unique name being a combination of the event name and this action's name.
